subject: p16848073
History: History of invasive adenocarcinoma of the esophagus. Recent respiratory acidosis and AFib with RVR.
Findings: There has been interval increase in the pulmonary edema, greater on the right than on the left. There are bilateral small pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis. There is stable widening of the mediastinum. A right chest tube is seen and unchanged from the prior exams. There are multiple overlying wires. The cardiomediastinal silhouette is unchanged.
Impression: Worsening of the patients pulmonary edema, more severe on the right than on the left. Bibasilar pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis.
